EnhanceR Symposium 2023

Research Software Engineering

  • Home
  • Timetable
  • Registration

EnhanceR Symposium 2023 will take place in Bern on Wednesday, October 18, 2023.

If you are registered, you will receive all news about the schedule by email.

Overview schedule
9:30–10:00 Registration / Coffee
10:00–10:15 Welcome
10:15–11:00 The growth of Research Software Engineering and its vital place in research (Simon Hettrick)
11:00–11:30 SWITCH Cloud - The cloud for education and research (Visho Jesudasan)
11:30–12:00 Collaborative expertise: synergies between multi-disciplinary experts and end users in software development (Aaron Ponti)
12:00–13:00 Show-and-tell parallel sessions (TBD)
13:00–14:00 Lunch (restaurant Grosse Schanze)
14:00–14:30 Streamlining Research Data Storage: A user-centric approach (Julia Gustavsen)
14:30–15:00 EnhanceR Seminar announcement + community needs discussion
15:00–17:00 Show-and-tell parallel sessions (TBD)
17:00–17:10 Farewell

Show-and-tell sessions

The show-and-tell timetable is being finalized and will be posted soon. Tentative show and tell topics are listed below:

Show-and-tell topics
Aliaksandr Yakutovich AiiDAlab journey: navigating development challenges and community growth
Ana Stojiljkovic Usability when building UI, Documentation, Outreach
Andrei Plamada inseri.swiss – connecting data repositories, research methods, and researchers
Anna Sintsova Empowering biological data re-use with interactive dashboards
Chaoran Chen GenSpectrum: Database Engine and Dashboards for Genomic Epidemiology
Daniel Roten Scalable Lidar data processing pipeline for the generation of 3D fuel models for wildfire simulations
David Meyer Automated Lab Data Management - from experiment to report
Enkelejda Miho Personalis: a clinical decision support software for the personalized diagnosis of autoimmune diseases
Franziska Oschmann MIDAP: development of an image analysis software for cell segmentation and tracking
Michal Okoniewski Reproducibility in practice: Snakemake with Galaxy containers
Mykhailo Vladymyrov Modern ways of thinking about research data: relations, representations, storage, safety, flow, and impact
Simone Baffelli OpenBIS chef: on-demand custom data entry workflows for ELNs
